meanings.definition: To mar the appearance of; spoil
meanings.sent1: The mud disfiguring her dress made her sad.
meanings.sent2: The graffiti disfiguring the wall was an eyesore.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought disfiguring the garden gnome was a fun prank.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds disfiguring the sky signaled an impending downpour.
meanings.sent5: The sharp claws of the cat left a disfiguring mark on the furniture.

meanings.definition: To impair the beauty or appearance of
meanings.sent1: The scar disfiguring her face made her self-conscious.
meanings.sent2: The smudged makeup was disfiguring her natural beauty.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy magician accidentally disfiguring his own hat drew laughter from the audience.
meanings.sent4: The fog disfiguring the landscape created an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The rust disfiguring the old car gave it a weathered look.

meanings.definition: To alter the appearance of in a negative way
meanings.sent1: The plastic surgery gone wrong disfiguring her features was a cautionary tale.
meanings.sent2: The mold disfiguring the bread made it inedible.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child disfiguring the snowman's face with coal and carrots was scolded by his parents.
meanings.sent4: The shadows disfiguring the painting gave it a mysterious aura.
meanings.sent5: The wrinkles disfiguring his once smooth skin revealed the passage of time.
